results.title: Heart disease
results.brief_description: Neil created this story as a document of how surviving a heart attack completely changed his life. Created as part of ‘The Heart of the Story / Telling Stories, Building Communities’ Digital Storytelling Project ACMI in association with the National Heart Foundation of Australia (Victorian Division) and supported by Vic Health.

results.title: Max and Noel Oliver's story
results.brief_description:
Alzheimer’s sufferer Max together with his wife Noel have told a story for their granddaughters that celebrates their life together as well as capturing Max’s memories of his son, the children’s father, who died when they were very young. Created as part of the ‘Memory’s Voice: Capturing Stories of Courage’ workshop, an ACMI Digital Storytelling Project in association with Alzheimer’s Australia Vic and in partnership with VicHealth.
You can create your own Digital Story. Ask at the Information Desk or visit www.acmi.net.au/digitalstorytelling

group.title: Memory's voice: capturing stories of courage

results.title: How to kill your husband
results.brief_description: Shirley’s father, a skilled mechanic and excellent drummer, suffered from heart disease. Shirley retells her father’s history, from the struggles of growing up during the depression to his now proud children, grandchildren and great-grandchildren. Made as part of ‘The Heart of the Story’ in association with Vic Health and the Heart Foundation.

results.title: 50 years of cardiology
results.brief_description: Working in cardiology for many years, Graeme Sloman explains the many achievements he and his fellow colleagues have made in preventing heart disease-related fatalities and building a greater public awareness of heart disease. Created as part of ‘The Heart of the Story’ an ACMI Digital Storytelling Project in association with the National Heart Foundation of Australia (Victorian Division) and in partnership with VicHealth.

results.title: Heart research
results.brief_description: David Crawford has always studied and worked in the field of science. With assistance from the Heart Foundation, it’s his work in public health research that provides the most satisfaction. Created as part of ‘The Heart of the Story’ in association with Vic Health and the Heart Foundation.

results.title: The Youth who wanted to shiver
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, C B Wismar, Nick Bosustow, Acton Films and Bosustow Entertainment

video_links.name: The Youth who wanted to shiver

results.brief_description: An animated adaptation of the classic fairy tale by the Brothers Grimm, about Jack who knows no fear and wants to be able to shiver. All help fails until his bride pours a bucket of tiny fish over him.

results.title: The Seven bridges of Koenigsberg
results.creator_credit: Bruce Cornwell and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: An animated film concerned with solving the problem of crossing the seven bridges of Koenigsberg, Germany, in a single continuous walk. Early attempts to solve it by trial and error are shown, including Leonard Euler’s analysis of the problem. This is a clearly explained and attractive film which would complement a study on topology or network theory. No other credits available. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Fisherman & his wife: a Grimm's fairy tale
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, C B Wismar, Nick Bosustow, Bosustow Entertainment and Churchill Films

video_links.name: Fisherman & his wife: a Grimm's fairy tale

results.brief_description: A Grimm’s fairy tale about a humble fisherman who frees a prince from a spell. The fisherman’s wife siezes the opportunity to have all her wishes granted but ends up where she started, thus learning a bitter lesson.
